required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase 2, Multicenter, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Study to Evaluate the Efficacy, Safety, and Tolerability of TAK-935 (OV935) as an Adjunctive Therapy in Pediatric Participants With Developmental and/or Epileptic Encephalopathies
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2, Multicenter, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Study to Evaluate the Efficacy, Safety, and Tolerability of TAK-935 (OV935) as an Adjunctive Therapy in Pediatric Patients With Developmental and/or Epileptic Encephalopathies

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate the effect on the frequency of all seizures (convulsive and drop) in participants treated with TAK-935 compared to placebo.

detailed_description.textblock:
The drug being tested in this study is called TAK-935 (OV935). This randomized, double-blind study will assess the effects of TAK-935 (OV935), compared to placebo, on efficacy, safety, and tolerability in pediatric participants with Dravet syndrome (DS) or Lennox Gastaut syndrome (LGS). This multi-center trial will be conducted worldwide and will enroll approximately 126 participants.
Participants will be randomized based on their diagnosis in 2 categories; DS or LGS. The study will consist of 2 periods: Screening Period and Treatment Period. The overall duration of Treatment Period is up to 20 weeks including 8-week Dose Optimization Period and 12-week Maintenance Period. The overall time to participants in this study is approximately 30 weeks.
Participants completing this study will have an option to enroll in the open-label extension study, under a separate protocol.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Seizure Frequency Per 28 Days During the Maintenance Period
primary_outcome.description: Seizure frequency per 28 days is defined as total number of seizures (convulsive seizures for DS, drop seizures for LGS) reported during the period divided by number of days during the period seizures were assessed multiplied by 28. Percent change from Baseline is defined as (frequency of seizures per 28 days during maintenance period - frequency of seizures per 28 days at baseline) divided by frequency of seizures per 28 days at baseline multiplied by 100. Negative percent change from Baseline indicates improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Seizure Frequency Per 28 Days During the Treatment Period
secondary_outcome.description: Seizure Frequency per 28 days is defined as total number of Seizures reported (convulsive seizures for DS, drop seizures for LGS) during the period divided by number of days during the period seizures were assessed multiplied by 28. Percent Change from Baseline is defined as (frequency of seizures per 28 days during treatment period - frequency of seizures per 28 days at baseline) divided by frequency of seizures per 28 days at baseline multiplied by 100. Negative percent change from Baseline indicates improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Convulsive Seizure Frequency Per 28 Days in Participants With Dravet Syndrome Stratum During the Maintenance Period
secondary_outcome.description: Convulsive seizure frequency per 28 days is defined as total number of convulsive seizures reported during the period divided by number of days during the period seizures were assessed multiplied by 28. Percent Change from Baseline (%) is defined as [(Maintenance Period Convulsive Seizure Frequency - Baseline Period Convulsive Seizure Frequency) divided by Baseline Convulsive Seizure Frequency] multiplied by 100. Negative percent change from Baseline indicates improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Drop Seizure Frequency Per 28 Days in Participants With the Lennox-Gastaut Syndrome (LGS) Stratum During the Maintenance Period
secondary_outcome.description: Drop seizure frequency per 28 days is defined as total number of drop seizures reported during the period divided by number of days during the period seizures were assessed multiplied by 28. Percent Change from Baseline (%) is defined as [(Maintenance Period Drop Seizure Frequency - Baseline Period Drop Seizure Frequency) divided by Baseline Drop Seizure Frequency] multiplied by 100. Negative percent change from Baseline indicates improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With LGS Stratum Considered Treatment Responders Throughout the Maintenance Period
secondary_outcome.description: Responders are defined as having over 50% drop seizure reduction compared to Baseline. Percent Reduction from Baseline (%) is defined as [(Maintenance Period Drop Seizure Frequency - Baseline Period Drop Seizure Frequency) divided by Baseline Drop Seizure Frequency] multiplied by 100. Data is reported as reduction of 25%, 50%, 75% and 100% or more in drop seizures from Baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Dravet Syndrome Stratum Considered Treatment Responders Throughout the Maintenance Period
secondary_outcome.description: Responders are defined as having over 50% convulsive seizure reduction compared to Baseline. Percent Reduction from Baseline (%) is defined as [(Maintenance Period Convulsive Seizure Frequency - Baseline Period Convulsive Seizure Frequency) divided by Baseline Convulsive Seizure Frequency] multiplied by 100. Data is reported as reduction of 25%, 50%, 75% and 100% or more in drop seizures from Baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Clinician's Clinical Global Impression of Severity (CGI-S) Responses of Investigator Reported Impression of Efficacy and Tolerability of Study Drug
secondary_outcome.description: The CGI-Severity (CGI-S) focuses on clinicians' observations of the participant's cognitive, functional, and behavioral performance since the beginning of the study. The CGI-S is rated on a 7-point scale, with the severity of illness scale using a range of responses from 1 (normal) through to 7 (amongst the most severely ill participants). A negative change from Baseline indicates improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Clinical Global Impression of Change (CGI-C) Responses as Per the Investigator Reported Impression of Efficacy and Tolerability TAK-935
secondary_outcome.description: CGI-Change (CGI-C) treatment response ratings should take account of both therapeutic efficacy and treatment-related AEs. Each component of the CGI is rated separately; the instrument does not yield a global score. The CGI-C is rated on a 7-point scale, where, 0 = Marked improvement and no side-effects, 1 = Marked improvement and minimal side-effects, 2 = No Change, 3 = Minimal improvement and marked side-effects and 4 = Unchanged or worse and side-effects outweigh the therapeutic effect. Lower scores indicated improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Caregiver Global Impression of Change (Care GI-C) Responses as Per the Parent/Family Reported Impression of Efficacy and Tolerability of TAK-935
secondary_outcome.description: The Care GI-C is rated on a 7-point scale, with the severity of illness scale where, 1 = Very much improved, 2 = Much improved, 3 = Slightly improved, 4 = No change, 5 = Slightly worse, 6 = Much worse and 7 = Very much worse. Lower scores indicated improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Plasma 24S-Hydroxycholesterol (24HC) Levels in Participants Treated With TAK-935 as an Adjunctive Therapy
secondary_outcome.description: A negative change from Baseline indicates improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Seizure Frequency in Participants Treated With TAK-935 as an Adjunctive Therapy
secondary_outcome.description: Seizure frequency was based on convulsive seizures for the participants in the Dravet Syndrome Indication and Drop Seizures for the participants in the LGS Indication. Seizure frequency per 28 days = (total number of seizures reported during the period) / (number of days during the period seizures were assessed) * 28. A negative change from Baseline indicates improvement.

arm_group.description: TAK-935 placebo-matching tablets, orally or via gastrostomy tube (G-tube)/percutaneous endoscopic gastrostomy (PEG), twice a day (BID) up to Week 20.

TAK-935 tablets orally or via G-tube/PEG tube, BID. Participants weighing <60 kg received total daily dose of study drug calculated based on body weight. Participants weighing ≥60 kg at Baseline, were administered with 200 mg/day followed by 400 mg/day, then 600 mg/day, up to Week 20.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Male and female participants aged greater than or equal to (>=) 2 and less than or equal to (<=) 17 years
2. Clinical diagnosis of DS or LGS
3. Weight of >=10 kilogram (kg) at the Screening visit
4. Currently taking 1 to 4 anti-epileptic drugs (AEDs) at a stable dose
5. Failed to become and remain seizure free with trials of at least 2 AEDs
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Has been admitted to a medical facility and intubated for treatment of status epilepticus 2 or more times in the 3 months immediately prior to the screening visit
2. Non-epileptic events that cannot be reliably distinguished from epileptic seizures
3. Participation in a clinical study involving another study drug in the previous month

patient_data.ipd_description: Takeda provides access to the de-identified individual participant data (IPD) for eligible studies to aid qualified researchers in addressing legitimate scientific objectives (Takeda's data sharing commitment is available on https://clinicaltrials.takeda.com/takedas-commitment?commitment=5). These IPDs will be provided in a secure research environment following approval of a data sharing request, and under the terms of a data sharing agreement.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: IPD from eligible studies will be shared with qualified researchers according to the criteria and process described on https://vivli.org/ourmember/takeda/. For approved requests, the researchers will be provided access to anonymized data (to respect patient privacy in line with applicable laws and regulations) and with information necessary to address the research objectives under the terms of a data sharing agreement.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants took part in the study at 45 investigative sites globally from 8 August 2018 to 20 July 2020.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Participants with a diagnosis of Dravet syndrome (DS) or Lennox-Gastaut syndrome (LGS) were enrolled and randomized in a 1:1 ratio to double-blind treatment with TAK-935 or matching placebo for up to the 20-week Treatment Period (8-week Dose Optimization Period and 12-week Maintenance Period).

group.title: Placebo
group.description: TAK-935 placebo-matching tablets, orally or via gastrostomy tube (G-tube)/percutaneous endoscopic gastrostomy (PEG), twice a day (BID) up to Week 20.

group.title: TAK-935
group.description: TAK-935 tablets orally or via G-tube/PEG tube, BID. Participants weighing <60 kg received total daily dose of study drug calculated based on body weight. Participants weighing ≥60 kg at Baseline, were administered with 200 mg/day followed by 400 mg/day, then 600 mg/day, up to Week 20.

baseline.population: Randomized Analysis Set included all participants who were randomized into the study.

measure.title: Clinical Global Impression of Severity (CGI-S) Responses of Investigator
measure.description: The CGI-Severity (CGI-S) focuses on clinicians' observations of the participant's cognitive, functional, and behavioral performance since the beginning of the study. The CGI-S is rated on a 7-point scale, with the severity of illness scale using a range of responses from 1 (normal) through to 7 (amongst the most severely ill participants).
measure.population: Efficacy Analysis Set included all mITT participants whose efficacy assessments were compliant with Protocol Amendment 2.

outcome.title: Percent Change From Baseline in Seizure Frequency Per 28 Days During the Maintenance Period
outcome.description: Seizure frequency per 28 days is defined as total number of seizures (convulsive seizures for DS, drop seizures for LGS) reported during the period divided by number of days during the period seizures were assessed multiplied by 28. Percent change from Baseline is defined as (frequency of seizures per 28 days during maintenance period - frequency of seizures per 28 days at baseline) divided by frequency of seizures per 28 days at baseline multiplied by 100. Negative percent change from Baseline indicates improvement.
outcome.population: Efficacy Analysis Set included all Modified Intent-to-Treat (mITT) participants whose efficacy assessments were compliant with Protocol Amendment 2. Overall number analyzed is the number of participants with data available for analyses.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: TAK-935 placebo-matching tablets, orally or via G-tube/PEG, BID up to Week 20.

group.title: TAK-935
group.description: TAK-935 tablets orally or via G-tube/PEG tube, BID. Participants weighing <60 kg received total daily dose of study drug calculated based on body weight. Participants weighing ≥60 kg at Baseline, were administered with 200 mg/day followed by 400 mg/day, then 600 mg/day, up to Week 20.

measure.title: Percent Change From Baseline in Seizure Frequency Per 28 Days During the Maintenance Period
measure.description: Seizure frequency per 28 days is defined as total number of seizures (convulsive seizures for DS, drop seizures for LGS) reported during the period divided by number of days during the period seizures were assessed multiplied by 28. Percent change from Baseline is defined as (frequency of seizures per 28 days during maintenance period - frequency of seizures per 28 days at baseline) divided by frequency of seizures per 28 days at baseline multiplied by 100. Negative percent change from Baseline indicates improvement.
measure.population: Efficacy Analysis Set included all Modified Intent-to-Treat (mITT) participants whose efficacy assessments were compliant with Protocol Amendment 2. Overall number analyzed is the number of participants with data available for analyses.

analysis.p_value_desc: The p-value is 2-sided and it is for the difference of percent change from baseline between TAK-935 and Placebo were computed using Rank Transformed Analysis of Covariance (ANCOVA) adjusting for baseline seizure frequency and indication.
analysis.estimate_desc: The location shift (TAK-935 - Placebo) and Asymptotic 95% confidence interval between TAK-935 and Placebo (TAK-935 - Placebo) were based on Hodges-Lehmann Estimation from un-adjusted rank statistics.

outcome.title: Percent Change From Baseline in Seizure Frequency Per 28 Days During the Treatment Period
outcome.description: Seizure Frequency per 28 days is defined as total number of Seizures reported (convulsive seizures for DS, drop seizures for LGS) during the period divided by number of days during the period seizures were assessed multiplied by 28. Percent Change from Baseline is defined as (frequency of seizures per 28 days during treatment period - frequency of seizures per 28 days at baseline) divided by frequency of seizures per 28 days at baseline multiplied by 100. Negative percent change from Baseline indicates improvement.
outcome.population: Efficacy Analysis Set included all mITT participants whose efficacy assessments were compliant with Protocol Amendment 2.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Clinician's Clinical Global Impression of Severity (CGI-S) Responses of Investigator Reported Impression of Efficacy and Tolerability of Study Drug
outcome.description: The CGI-Severity (CGI-S) focuses on clinicians' observations of the participant's cognitive, functional, and behavioral performance since the beginning of the study. The CGI-S is rated on a 7-point scale, with the severity of illness scale using a range of responses from 1 (normal) through to 7 (amongst the most severely ill participants). A negative change from Baseline indicates improvement.
outcome.population: Efficacy Analysis Set included all mITT participants whose efficacy assessments were compliant with Protocol Amendment 2. Overall number analyzed is the number of participants with data available for analyses.

analysis.p_value_desc: The p-value is 2-sided and it is for the difference (TAK-935 - Placebo) of change from baseline between TAK-935 and Placebo was computed using MMRM.
analysis.estimate_desc: The MMRM model included treatment and visit as factors along with treatment*visit interaction and baseline score as a covariate; and visit as repeated measure.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Clinical Global Impression of Change (CGI-C) Responses as Per the Investigator Reported Impression of Efficacy and Tolerability TAK-935
outcome.description: CGI-Change (CGI-C) treatment response ratings should take account of both therapeutic efficacy and treatment-related AEs. Each component of the CGI is rated separately; the instrument does not yield a global score. The CGI-C is rated on a 7-point scale, where, 0 = Marked improvement and no side-effects, 1 = Marked improvement and minimal side-effects, 2 = No Change, 3 = Minimal improvement and marked side-effects and 4 = Unchanged or worse and side-effects outweigh the therapeutic effect. Lower scores indicated improvement.
outcome.population: Efficacy Analysis Set included all mITT participants whose efficacy assessments were compliant with Protocol Amendment 2. Overall number analyzed is the number of participants with data available for analyses.

Participants weighing ≥60 kg at Baseline, were administered with 200 mg/day followed by 400 mg/day, then 600 mg/day, up to Week 20.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Caregiver Global Impression of Change (Care GI-C) Responses as Per the Parent/Family Reported Impression of Efficacy and Tolerability of TAK-935
measure.description: The Care GI-C is rated on a 7-point scale, with the severity of illness scale where, 1 = Very much improved, 2 = Much improved, 3 = Slightly improved, 4 = No change, 5 = Slightly worse, 6 = Much worse and 7 = Very much worse. Lower scores indicated improvement.
measure.population: Efficacy Analysis Set included all mITT participants whose efficacy assessments were compliant with Protocol Amendment 2. Overall number analyzed is the number of participants with data available for analyses.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Plasma 24S-Hydroxycholesterol (24HC) Levels in Participants Treated With TAK-935 as an Adjunctive Therapy
outcome.description: A negative change from Baseline indicates improvement.
outcome.population: Efficacy Analysis Set included all mITT participants whose efficacy assessments were compliant with Protocol Amendment 2, with available data. Number analyzed is the number of participants with Baseline and Week 24 data available for analyses.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: TAK-935 placebo-matching tablets, orally or via G-tube/PEG, BID up to Week 20.

group.title: TAK-935
group.description: TAK-935 tablets orally or via G-tube/PEG tube, BID. Participants weighing <60 kg received total daily dose of study drug calculated based on body weight. Participants weighing ≥60 kg at Baseline, were administered with 200 mg/day followed by 400 mg/day, then 600 mg/day, up to Week 20.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Plasma 24S-Hydroxycholesterol (24HC) Levels in Participants Treated With TAK-935 as an Adjunctive Therapy
measure.description: A negative change from Baseline indicates improvement.
measure.population: Efficacy Analysis Set included all mITT participants whose efficacy assessments were compliant with Protocol Amendment 2, with available data. Number analyzed is the number of participants with Baseline and Week 24 data available for analyses.

measurement_list.measurement: Standard deviation was not estimable for 1 participant.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Seizure Frequency in Participants Treated With TAK-935 as an Adjunctive Therapy
outcome.description: Seizure frequency was based on convulsive seizures for the participants in the Dravet Syndrome Indication and Drop Seizures for the participants in the LGS Indication. Seizure frequency per 28 days = (total number of seizures reported during the period) / (number of days during the period seizures were assessed) * 28. A negative change from Baseline indicates improvement.
outcome.population: Efficacy Analysis Set included all mITT participants whose efficacy assessments were compliant with Protocol Amendment 2, with available data. Number analyzed is the number of participants with Baseline and Week 24 data available for analyses.

Participants weighing ≥60 kg at Baseline, were administered with 200 mg/day followed by 400 mg/day, then 600 mg/day, up to Week 20.

measure.description: Seizure frequency was based on convulsive seizures for the participants in the Dravet Syndrome Indication and Drop Seizures for the participants in the LGS Indication. Seizure frequency per 28 days = (total number of seizures reported during the period) / (number of days during the period seizures were assessed) * 28. A negative change from Baseline indicates improvement.

reported_events.time_frame: From the first dose to 30 days post-last dose of study treatment (Up to 24 weeks)
reported_events.desc: At each visit the investigator had to document any occurrence of adverse events and abnormal laboratory findings. Any event spontaneously reported by the participant or observed by the investigator was recorded, irrespective of the relation to study treatment.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: TAK-935 placebo-matching tablets, orally or via G-tube/PEG, BID up to Week 20.

group.title: TAK-935
group.description: TAK-935 tablets orally or via G-tube/PEG tube, BID. Participants weighing <60 kg received total daily dose of study drug calculated based on body weight. Participants weighing ≥60 kg at Baseline, were administered with 200 mg/day followed by 400 mg/day, then 600 mg/day, up to Week 20.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The first study related publication will be a multi-center publication submitted within 24 months after conclusion or termination of a study at all sites. After such multi site publication, all proposed site publications and presentations will be submitted to sponsor for review 60 days in advance of publication. Site will remove Sponsor confidential information unrelated to study results. Sponsor can delay a proposed publication for another 60 days to preserve intellectual property.
